intro: Centaurea nigrescens var. microptilon, commonly known as the dwarf black-centaury, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender stems and small, dark purple to black flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. This variety is characterized by its compact growth and striking dark floral coloration.
